alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford, southeastern Alachua, north central Marion, west central Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawthorne, or 8 miles north of Citra, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, half inch hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Interlachen, Melrose, Citra, Hawthorne, University Of Florida, Rochelle, Melrose Landing, Cross Creek and Orange Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam
